The harmful items sound provocative, but tell me: whats the point of cheats
that hurt you?

Although it may entirely revamp the game, at one point, I was thinking about
how interesting it would be for characters to have an inventory.  Something
really simple, like, armor and weapon.  There would be an activation key to
bring up inventory for character (only out of combat, or in if you liked)
with his currently eqipeed weapon, and his currently equiped armor, plus a
list of all the weapons and armor he had.  From this menu, you could swap
out armors, swap out weapons, etc.  Also, the inventory would be of the
whole team, not of just this one character.  Too keep this very simple,
characters could only use thier own class related weapon, ie: Soldier could
only use blades.  When he kills an enemy soldier/hero soldier, there would
be a chance of dropping a blade.  When the soldier walks up to the corpse,
he would pick up this blade and put it in the team inventory similar to
eating meat, or drinking a potion.  Should a character die, his equipment
would be lost/fall to the ground.

Some weapons stuff (while i'm rambling so i don't forget):
druid: lightning staff
cleric: mace/holy staff
archer: bow
thief: knives
mage: force wand
um... yeah, you might get the point...

Armor would be universally equippable.

Items in inventory might also be able to be 'sold' in the menu, trading it
for cash.

Now, what effectively weapons would do, is, based on what the weapon
attributes are, increase damage basically.  Armor would obviously add armor,
similar to the stat.

Well...  thats my craziness for today

-----Original Message-----
From: Daniel Paul Hightower [mailto:alternate_dph@...]
Sent: Saturday, August 30, 2003 5:26 PM
To: gladiator@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [gladiator] Negative Items


How many people would like to see items in Gladiator that do harm?

Something like "spoiled meat" that would reduce health, potions that
would take away mana, slow down a player, etc?

Along the same lines, I would actually like "cheat codes" that do
"harm".
